comments.raw_text:
The test attempts to check, whether PR_Select() recognizes an invalid (closed) file-descriptor among those passed to it.

To this end, it may just as well use PR_INTERVAL_NO_WAIT. Using PR_INTERVAL_NO_TIMEOUT leads to indefinite wait, when PR_Select() fails the test -- instead of the instant error report.

Also, when the test's failure is detected, the test-program should exit with non-zero code...

Created attachment 539712
Trivial patch correcting the situation

The test attempts to check, whether PR_Select() recognizes an invalid (closed) file-descriptor among those passed to it.

To this end, it may just as well use PR_INTERVAL_NO_WAIT. Using PR_INTERVAL_NO_TIMEOUT leads to indefinite wait, when PR_Select() fails the test -- instead of the instant error report.

Also, when the test's failure is detected, the test-program should exit with non-zero code...
